condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I.A1. Establish by not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain throughoutthe period of implementation of the Project, a Coordination Committee with composition and terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation led by the chairman of FBR and comprised of focal persons for each of the DLIs to coordinate the implementation of theProject in their respective departments, including liaising with the Program Office, change management and internal communications.

Schedule 2, Section I.A2. Establish by not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain throughoutthe period of implementation of the Project, a Program Office reporting to the chairman of FBR with composition and terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association to undertake horizontal Project implementation functions, including procurement, contractmanagement, budget planning, financial reporting, preparation of results reports based on data provided by the implementingdepartments, day-to-day coordination of Project activities with implementing departments and the Association, oversight andreporting on the implementation of the ESCP, Project communications and coordination of the verification of results by anindependent entity or entities.

Schedule 2, Section I.A3. Notwithstanding paragraph 2 of this Section above, externally recruit and hire to work within theProgram Office by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, (a) procurement specialist; (b) financial managementspecialist; (c) contract management specialist; (d) environmental and social specialist to ensure compliance with the Environmentaland Social Standards; all with terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I.A4. Establish by not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain throughoutthe period of implementation of the Project, a Steering Committee with composition and terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation chaired by the Minister of Finance or an authorized representative as the Minister may designate to take stock ofimplementation progress and provide guidance to the Coordination Committee and the Program Office.

title.narrative: Effective risk management in Customs (% inspections & audits that detect material violations)
Resolution of refunds (% of refunds claims resolved within 90 days)
Hours to prepare, file and pay/withhold CIT and GST measured by 'paying taxes indicator' in Doing Business (excluding social security contributions)
Hours spent for customs clearance at the border per the 'trading across borders' Doing Business indicator (average of exports, imports)
Obsolete ICT equipment replaced, legacy branded software updated, and active-active private cloud established
Customs border stations with Automated Entry-Exit System
FBR offices with full, permanent and reliable connectivity
Data Warehouse with big data capacity and Business Intelligence tools are functional
Automated sharing of taxpayer data (number of entities sharing data with the FBR)
Technical streams and specialized functions established

baseline.value: FBR staff are not assigned to a specific function with career prospects within the function. Specialized non-core functions(procurement, internal audit, communications, human resource management) staffed by generalists from within FBR.

target.value: At least 40% of grade 17 officers assigned to a technical stream and receive specialized training. Dedicated units for non-corefunctions established and staffed with externally hired professionals.

actual.value: Technical streams have not been established.

title.narrative: Authorized Economic Operator (AEO) program (# of firms accredited)

actual.value: 3 firm registered in the pilot program

baseline.value: No regular monitoring and reporting system on tax arrears in place.

target.value: Tax arrears tracked through Management Information System, collectability analyzed, and at least of 60% of collectable arrears atthe start of the FY are recovered.

baseline.value: Online filing and payment, and ATM payments launched.

target.value: Taxpayers able to offset liabilities against receivables (i.e. refunds due) from previous fiscal years and across tax instruments.

actual.value: Taxpayers are able to check their profile and status of tax transactions, liabilities, and refunds online in IRIS system. Moreover,new Simplified Income Tax Return for Retailers & Manufacturers has been introduced.

title.narrative: Timely transfer tax receipts and reconciliation of accounts in the TSA

baseline.value: Some tax receipts are reported manually and transferred to the TSA with a delay of 30 days or more.

target.value: Banks transfer tax receipts to the TSA at the end of each business day and reconciliation of accounts takes place monthly.

actual.value: The reconciliation of tax receipts by FBR has been completed for the Year ending 30.06.2021.

baseline.value: Tax laws do not incorporate later amendments in the main text and have different provisions for tax administration. Customs Act notfully in line with international agreements that Pakistan is a party to.

target.value: Tax laws updated to include all subsequent amendments in the text; unified tax administration provisions for all tax instruments;and Customs Act is fully aligned with Kyoto and TIR Conventions.

actual.value: Customs Act is being revised to ensure compliance with Kyoto and TIR Conventions. To comply with standard 3.25 of Revised KyotoConvention, Pre-arrival /preclearance system was introduced in FY 2020-21. This has also allowed for conformity with Article No. 7of Trade Facilitation Agreement.
